page.title: 14Portsmouth Football Club
page.content: PFC's ground,{Fratton Park,}which is in Frogmore Road, was bought as arable land in 1897. The main stand has stood there ever since. It held{46000}people in 1939, the year they won the FA Cup. The Pompey Chimes are famed through -out the football world. The violence in Brussels may have put off supporters at some clubs but not Portsmouth's{loyal fans}who come for the excitement of the match. One stand is reserved for children and pensioners. The present manager, Alan Ball, is a former captain of England. Recently, 'Pompey' have gained much money from the sale of international{Mark Hateley to AC Milan, but just missed promotion to{Division One.}Next year, it will be different! -Graham Brown,James Bobin: Portsmouth Grammar School
